headline: Marriott Scales Back 2025 Growth After Sonder Default
summary: Short-term rental partner's exit trims expansion outlook to 4.5%

raw.headline: Marriott Scales Back 2025 Growth After Sonder Default
raw.summary: Short-term rental partner's exit trims expansion outlook to 4.5%

headline: Sonder Holdings Inc. To Complete Immediate Wind-Down of Operations
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Sonder Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: SOND) (“Sonder” or the “Company”), which operates a global brand of premium, design-forward apartments and intimate boutique hotels serving the modern traveler, today announced that it will complete winding down operations immediately and expects to initiate a Chapter 7 liquidation of its U.S. business. The Company also intends to initiate insolvency proceedings in the international countries in which it operates. Son

headline: Brian Chesky says Airbnb’s successful IPO was ‘one of the saddest periods’ of his life—then Barack Obama gave him one piece of advice
summary: "You’re connected to your roots, and your roots are the relationships in your past,” Barack Obama advised Chesky.

raw.headline: Brian Chesky says Airbnb’s successful IPO was ‘one of the saddest periods’ of his life—then Barack Obama gave him one piece of advice

headline: Marriott International (MAR): Assessing Current Valuation Following Recent Growth Signals
summary: Marriott International (MAR) shares have inched up roughly 4% over the past month, as investors evaluate the company’s steady performance and recent growth numbers. The stock’s year-to-date trend suggests ongoing interest in the travel sector. See our latest analysis for Marriott International. Zooming out, Marriott International’s share price has delivered a robust 11.9% gain over the past month, building on recent momentum after several signals of sector strength. While short-term gains...

headline: Marriott terminates licensing agreement with Sonder
summary: The deal “is no longer in effect due to Sonder’s default,” according to a Marriott news release.

headline: Pacifica Hotels G. K. to Debut City Express by Marriott in Asia Pacific
summary: TOKYO, Nov. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Pacifica Hotels G.K. announced today that it has signed a franchise agreement with Marriott International Inc. to bring City Express by Marriott to Japan with the conversion of two existing hotels in Osaka. Following a complete rebrand, the hotels are expected to re-open in Spring 2026 as City Express by Marriott Osaka Namba South and City Express by Marriott Osaka Shin-Imamiya. Together, these openings are expected to mark the debut of the midscale City
